SENT.plain: We have compared the growth in agarose medium of two EBV-negative Burkitt lymphoma lines, BJAB and Ramos, and that of their EBV-converted derivatives
Optimal conditions for growth in agarose medium are described
The original EBV-negative lines can grow in agarose to a high efficiency, provided a critical level of cell concentration is attained
Below this level, there is no growth at all
EBV-converted sublines form colonies at a much lower cell concentration, and their maximal plating efficiency is higher
These differences may be related to a super-transformation state induced in these cells by EBV
